meanings.definition: The study of statistics such as births, deaths, income, or the incidence of disease, which illustrate the changing structure of human populations.
meanings.sent1: Demography helps us understand how populations change over time.
meanings.sent2: The demography of our town shows an increase in the number of elderly residents.
meanings.sent3: In a quirky twist, the demography of the office revealed a surprising number of cat lovers.
meanings.sent4: The demography of the city painted a vivid picture of its diversity.
meanings.sent5: Studying demography is like piecing together a puzzle of human society.

meanings.definition: The composition of a particular human population.
meanings.sent1: The demography of the school includes students from various cultural backgrounds.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the demography of a neighborhood can help in urban planning.
meanings.sent3: The demography of the party was a mix of young and old guests.
meanings.sent4: Her vibrant personality added color to the demography of the group.
meanings.sent5: The demography of the village was as diverse as a patchwork quilt.
